lines.text: Eat, Papa, eat.
How can I eat? That silly elf song is driving me crazy.
You're going to disappoint the children. They expect a fat Santa.

[to his sled dogs as they watch Santa's sleigh depart for the Island of Misfit Toys]
Now, you see how it's done? Wahooooo!
[tosses his pick-axe into the air, picks it up after it falls, and licks it]
Peppermint! What I've been searching for all my life! I've struck it rich! I've got me a peppermint mine! Wahooooo!
[Rudolph, Yukon, and Hermey are traveling through thick fog]
This fog's as thick as peanut butter!
You mean pea soup.
You eat what you like, and I'll eat what I like!
Hey, Clarice? After practice, would you... would you...
Rudolph! You get back here! It's your turn, you know!
Gee, I gotta go back!
[starts to run off but then runs back]
Would you walk home with me?
Uh-huh. Rudolph? I think you're cute.

[jumping around, on first flight]
I'm cute! I'm cuuuuuuuute!
What do you want?
You - You promised to walk me home.
Aren't you going to laugh at my nose, too?
I think it's a handsome nose. Much better than that silly false one you were wearing.
It's terrible... and it's different from everybody else's!
But that's what makes it so grand. Why, any doe would consider herself lucky to be with you.
Yeah? But I wasn't very lucky today, was I?

[holding up Rudolph's new nose for him to try on]
All right, son, try it on.
I don't wanna. Daddy, I don't like it.
You'll like it and wear it!
Aw, but Daddy...
[Donner slips the new nose over Rudolph's shiny one]
It's not very comfortable!
self respect! Santa can't object to you now.
Hermey! Aren't you finished painting that yet? There's a pile-up a mile wide behind you! What's eatin' ya, boy?
Not happy with my work, I guess.
What?

[sadly]
I just don't like to make toys.
Oh, well, if that's all... What? You don't like to make toys?

[sadly again]
Nnno.

[to the other elves]
Hermey doesn't like to make toys!

[whispering to each other, then chorusing to Hermey]
Hermey doesn't like to make toys. Shame on him!
Do you mind telling me what you do want to do?
Well, sir, someday, I'd like to be a... a dentist.
A - dentist?
Well, we need one up here. I've been studying. It's fascinating; you've no idea. Molars and bicuspids and incisors...
you're an elf, and elves make toys.
[shoving the dentistry book away and shoving the cart that Hermey was painting back to him]
Now, get to work!
[whistle blows]
Ten minute break!
[Hermey smiles, but then the head elf jumps him]
Not for you! Finish the job, or you're fired!
But - But you fell over the side of the cliff.
Didn't I ever tell you about Bumbles? Bumbles *bounce*!
From what I see now, that will cut through the murkiest storm they can dish up. What I'm trying to say is, Rudolph, with your nose so bright, won't you guide my sleigh tonight?
It would be an honor, sir.

[blows his whistle]
All right, all right, my yearlings, back to practice.
[to Rudolph]
Oh no, not you. You'd better go home with your folks. From now on, gang, we won't let Rudolph join in any reindeer games. Right?
[the others reply with scattered replies of "Right!"]
[first lines]

If I live to be 100, I'll never forget that big snow storm a couple of years ago. The weather closed in and, well you might not believe it, but the world almost missed Christmas. Oh, excuse me, call me Sam. What's the matter? Haven't you ever seen a talking snowman before?
Whoa. Whoaaaaaaaaaaa! Unmush, will ya?
Come closer. What do you desire?
Well, we're a couple of misfits from Christmastown, and now we'd like to live here.
No, that would not be possible. This island is for toys alone.
How do you like that? Even among misfits you're a misfit.

[driving his dogsled]
Mush! Don't you understand North Pole talk? Mush!
Why weren't you at elf practice?
Just fixing these dolls' teeth.
we have dolls that cry, talk, walk, blink and run a temperature. We don't need any chewing dolls!
But I just thought I'd find a way to - to fit in.
You'll never fit in! Now you come to elf practice, learn how to wiggle your ears, chuckle warmly, go "Hee-Hee" and "Ho-Ho", and important stuff like that. A dentist! Good grief!
[slams door]
Hey, what do you say we both be independent together, huh?
You wouldn't mind my - red nose?
Not if you don't mind me being a dentist.

[shaking hands with Hermey]
It's a deal.
Is something wrong with your nose? I mean, you talk kind of funny.

[about to lose his cool]
What's so funny about the way I talk?
Well, don't get angry. I don't mind.
I am the official sentry of the Island of Misfit Toys.
A jack-in-the-box for a sentry?
Yes. My name is...
Jack.
No, Charlie. That's why I'm a misfit toy. My name is all wrong. No child wants to play with a Charlie-In-The-Box, so I had to come here.
Where's "here"?
We'll have to outwit the fiend with our superior intelligence.
How?
Douse your nose and run like crazy!
You're going to stay with me and we'll all be rich with the biggest silver strike this side of Hudson Bay. Silverrrrrrr!
I thought you wanted gold.
I changed my mind.
Open up! It isn't a fit night out for man or beast.
[two elves open the doors so Cornelius enters with the Abominable Snowmonster]
Here's the man...
[Brings in the Abominable Snowmonster on a leash]
and here's the beast!
We'll simply have to overlook it.
How can you overlook that? His beak blinks like a blinking beacon.

[to Rudolph]
When someday, you return to Christmas Town, would you tell Santa about our homeless toys? I'm sure he will find little boys and girls who will be happy with them. A toy is never truly happy until it is loved by a child.
Okay, you can open a dentist office, next week, after Christmas.
Come here, open your mouth.

[groaning as he opens his mouth]
Ah...
30 sharp!
Papa, you haven't touched a morsel. I'll have to take this suit in. Eat!
I'm busy, Mama. It's almost Christmas.
Whoever heard of a skinny Santa? Eat. Eat!

how to get food, how to fight off enemies, things like that. But most important... most important of all, he taught his son to beware of the Abominable Snow Monster of the North. He's mean. He's nasty. And he hates everything to do with Christmas.
cornmeal and gun powder and hamhocks and guitar strings. I'll give you a lift. Hop aboard, mateys.
Ahh. I love this Christmasy time of year. Especially when everything is running happy and smooth, like it is this season. Nothing like that year of the big snow storms.
[shivers]
Well, as good as everyone feels, this is no time for celebrating, because the next day is Christmas Eve, the biggest day of the year!
home.

Now aside from the Abominable. Business goes on as usual. And soon, it is right before Christmas. And everybody's getting ready for that big, big sleigh ride on the night of the 24th, Christmas Eve. See, all the toys Santa brings are made by these elves. These elves have that certain knack for toy making, all except for this... this one misfit.

What's a Christmas tree without tinsel and pretty silver and gold decorations? Can't really call it a Christmas tree now, can you? And think of all the fun and joy that would be lost on Christmas morning, if all the young folks didn't get to see that sparkling, happy tree.
All up for elf practice!
Well, let's get this over with. I have to go down and look over the new deer.

[in a different voice]
Okay, Santa.
[to the elves]
Now let's try out the new elf song I wrote. And remember, it's for Santa.
[starts conducting]
And a one-a, and a two-a, and a three-a!

[after Yukon and the Bumble tumble over the cliff and Hermey and Rudolph assume they're dead]
Well, they are all very sad at the loss of their friend. But they realize that the best thing to do is to get the women back to Christmas Town. So they made it back, and when everybody hears their story, they start to realize maybe they were a little hard on the misfits. Maybe misfits have a place, too. Even Santa realizes that maybe - he was wrong.

[about the Bumble]
Don't let this big blowhard scare you anymore; just walk right past him.

[examining the weather report that one of the elves gave him]
Well, this is it. The storm won't subside by tonight. We - we'll have to cancel Christmas.

[sympathetically]
Papa, are you sure?

[crushed]
Everything's grounded. Aw, the poor kids, they've been so good this year, too. But I couldn't chance it. I'll have to tell everybody that it's all off this year.

[singing]
Jingle, jingle, jingle / You will hear my sleigh bells ring / I am old Kris Kringle / I'm the king of jing-a-ling.
Donner, you should be ashamed of yourself. What a pity. He had a nice takeoff, too.
Well now let me tell you about Rudolph. It all started a couple of years before the big snow. It was springtime, and Santa's lead reindeer, Donner, had just become a proud papa.

[musically]
Why am I such a misfit? I am not just a nitwit. You can't fire me, I quit. Seems I don't fit in.

[musically]
Why am I such a misfit? I am not just a nitwit. Just because my nose glows... why don't I fit in?
Goodbye, Cornelius. I hope you find lots of tinsel. Goodbye, Hermey. Whatever a dentist is, I hope someday you will be the greatest.
He's got a shiny nose.
Sh-sh-sh-shiny? I'd even say it glows.
Of course the number one residents up here are the Clauses, the Santa and the Missus. They live right over there. First castle on the left. As a matter of fact, the *only* castle on the left.
He'll be a hero after this!
Yes, a hero!
That's my little buck!
Now don't worry about your nose, son. Just get out there and do your stuff. Remember, you're my little buck.
Hey, we're all misfits, too. Maybe we could stay here for a while.
Well, you'll have to get permission from King Moonraiser.
Who's he?

He rules here. Every night, he searches the entire earth. When he finds a misfit toy, one that no little girl or boy loves, he brings it here to live on his island till someone wants it. He's holding court in his castle right now.
No, I just can't. It's like he said, I'll never fit in.
[goes to the workshop window and opens it, then climbs onto the sill in preparation to climb down]
I - I guess I'm on my own now.
[he jumps down]
How would you like to be a spotted elephant?
Or a choo-choo with square wheels on your caboose?

[shooting jelly toward Hermey]
Or a water pistol that shoots jelly?
We're all misfits!
How would you like to be a bird that doesn't fly? I swim!
Or a cowboy who rides - an ostrich?
Or a - a - a boat that can't stay a - afloat?
[it sinks]
We're all misfits!
Ah, youth. Meanwhile, the elves are bustling with activity. Christmas is over, but they still keep busy with lessons in elf improvement.
Now don't any of you worry your heads about Santa, Mrs. Claus will have him plenty fattened up before Christmas Eve. It's always the same story.
Great bouncing icebergs.
Ah, I'm sure it'll stop as soon as he grows up, Santa.
Well, let's hope so, if he wants to make the sleigh team someday.
[to Rudolph]
You see, little fellow, every year I shine up my jingle bells for eight lucky reindeer.
I don't know what we would have done without Rudolph to pull us through. Anyway - uh, Rudolph? Huh, could it be that some of you are not acquainted with the story of Rudolph?
[nods briefly]
Well, pull up an ice block and lend an ear. Now you know how Santa uses these flying reindeer to pull his sleigh.
[music commences]
You know Dasher... and Dancer, and Prancer, and Vixen; Comet, and Cupid, and Donner, and Blitzen.
Observe the Bumble's one weakness.
[he watches the Bumble put one foot into the water, then sinks]
The bumble sinks! Ha ha!

Now you can bet that old Donner felt pretty bad about the way he had treated Rudolph, and he knew that the only thing to do was to go out and look for his little buck. Mrs. Donner wanted to go along, naturally, but Donner said...
No. This is man's work.

And no sooner did the man of the house leave when Mrs. Donner and Clarice decided to set out on their own. Now they were really taking their chances, because you see, that little ice boat had run into a pack of mighty-weighted fog.
That sounded terrible! The tenor section was weak!
Wasn't our fault, boss. Hermey didn't show up.
What?
Like I said, the outside world is up to its ears in danger.

[laughs]
Silver and gold. Well, what do you think of our friend Cornelius? Seems all he thinks about is silver and gold.
Terrible weather we've been havin'!
[chuckles]
Snow, and ice!
[chuckles more]
Rudolph, I promise. As soon as this storm lets up, I'll find homes for all those misfit toys.
I've got some bad news, folks. Christmas is going to be cancelled.
Nice around here, isn't it? I call it Christmas Town, better known as the North Pole. A Christmas tree forest. Yep, here's where we grow 'em. Nice place to live, you know. Christmas seals.
Ah, well. Such is the life of an elf. Meanwhile, Rudolph is having his growing pains, too. Old Donner is determine to keep Rudolph's nose a secret.

[after "We are Santa's Elves"]
Well, it needs work. I have to go.
[leaves the room]

[to the Head Elf]
What does Papa know? It's beautiful! You keep it just the way it was.
[going after Santa]
Papa? Papa!
